sales module

exception sales.InsufficientAmount[source]

Bases: Exception

exception sales.OutOfStock[source]

Bases: Exception

sales.api_get_good(name)[source]

API implementation of get_good_by_name() :param name: name of the good whose details we want :type name: string :return: the information of the item :rtype: json object

sales.api_get_prices()[source]

API implementation of get_prices() :return: the prices of all items in the database :rtype: json object

sales.api_history(username)[source]

API implementation of get_history() :param username: username of the customer whose history we’re seeking :type username: string :return: Purchase history of the customer :rtype: json object

sales.api_sale(username, name)[source]

API implementation of sale() :param username: username of the customer who did the purchase :type username: string :param name: name of the good that got purchased :type name: string :return: A message confirming purchase status :rtype: json object

sales.get_good_by_name(name)[source]

Get the information of the good from the database using its name :param name: Name of the good we want to extract :type name: string :return: the information of the specified good :rtype: dictionary

sales.get_history(username)[source]

Given the username of the customer, this function returns the purchase history of this customer by adding the item to a dictionary. If it was already found, increase it value by one. If not, initialize it to 1. :param username: username of the customer whose history we want :type username: string :return: Purchase history of the customer :rtype: dictionary

sales.get_prices()[source]

Gets the name and the price of each element in the database :return: A list of dictionaries each containing the name and the price of the goods :rtype: list

sales.sale(username, name, amount)[source]

This is called when a purchase occured. The count of the item will be reduced by a certain amount and the users wallet will be reduced by the price by the item. It also calls the function to save the purchase in the database. :param username: username of the user who made the purchase :type username: string :param name: name of the item that got purchased :type name: string :raises InsufficientAmount: if the user doesn’t have the item’s price in his wallet, the error will be raised :raises OutOfStock: if the item’s count is equal to 0, the error will be raised :return: A message confirming purchase status :rtype: Dictionary

sales.save_purchase(username, name, amount)[source]

Saves the purchase made by a customer in the databse by saving his username and the name of the item :param username: username of the user who made the purchase :type username: string :param name: name of the item that got purchased :type name: string
